records.location_details: A group of ten migrants, starting from Belgrade, Serbia, were transported by Serbian police from a reception centre south of Belgrade to a shallow river near Dimitrovgrad, at the Serbian-Bulgarian border, and forced to cross into Bulgaria. They were subsequently apprehended by Bulgarian police in a village territory in Bulgaria, near the border.
records.location_text_raw: at the [REDACTED] in Bulgaria, public park in Belgrade, reception centre located 1.5-hour drive south of Belgrade, after passing Dimitrovgrad, the van reached a shallow river, what migrants assumed to be by the border with Bulgaria, territory of the village of [REDACTED] found and arrested ten persons without documents, location of the apprehension in Bulgaria [REDACTED] from the border with Serbia)
records.uncertainty_note: Specific river name and village in Bulgaria are redacted.
records.context_note: A group of ten migrants was apprehended by Serbian police in Serbia, transported from a reception centre to the Serbian-Bulgarian border near Dimitrovgrad, and allegedly subjected to ill-treatment, theft of phones/documents, and forced collective expulsion into Bulgaria. They were subsequently apprehended by Bulgarian police.
records.evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office concludes as likely that a group of ten migrants was apprehended by the Serbian police in Serbia, transported from the reception centre to the border with Bulgaria, and subsequently forced to cross the border.
